snippet: The Supreme Court is poised to take up the question of whether human genes can be patented. But some say advances in the field may blunt the impact of its ruling.
abstract: Supreme Court is poised to take up highly charged question of whether human genes can be patented in case involving patents held by Myriad Genetics; some experts say, however, that court's decision will be more ideological than practical, given that patents on isolated human genes are actually fading in importance as result of advances in the field.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court is poised to take up the question of whether human genes can be patented. But some say advances in the field may blunt the impact of its ruling.

headline.seo: As Court Considers Gene Patents, Case May Overlook Relevant Issues
headline.main: Justices Consider Whether Patents on Genes Are Valid
headline.print_headline: Justices Weigh Issue of Patents on Human Genes
